title: ​​rockstar
description: On January 9, 2018, “rockstar” broke the record for holding the number one spot on Spotify’s Global chart with 108 days spent on the top of the list. Post previewed the song in December 2016 by posting a video of himself jamming to it in the studio. Joey Bada$$ co-wrote the track as well as penning an extra verse after Music Mafia leaked the original version of the song.

annotations_with_timestamps.annotation: Olufunmibi Awoshiley, better known as Tank God, is a New York-based producer. Some notable artists Tank God has worked with include Lil Wayne, A$AP Rocky, and A Boogie wit da Hoodie. In an interview with Pigeons & Planes, Tank God confirmed that this laugh belonged to Post Malone. “Tracks” is slang for a type of hair extensions.

“Caking” means to spend time with a love interest and build a relationship. “Hard” is a street term for being tough. By saying “you are not hard”, 21 is saying this person isn’t tough enough for the streets. He compares them to a Pop-Tart, as they act hard on the outside but on the inside, they’re soft and sweet.

The Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards and keyboardist Bobby Keys launched their TV off of a West Hollywood hotel balcony in 1972. A Rasta is a follower of the Rastafari religion, a Jamaican movement that saw its first major rise in popularity in the 1930s. One of the most iconic Rastas was Bob Marley, who popularized the faith with his music in the ‘70s.

21 bragged about having eight million dollars to his name, and buying a house in the Hills. Hollywood Hills is an upscale neighborhood located deep in the Santa Monica Mountains. In 2013, $100 bills were updated to have more security features, such as a blue strip towards the center of the bill. 21’s bragging about saving his money and appreciating his wealth, but also calling back to his drug dealing days.

Post is putting his own spin on “sex, drugs, and rock and roll,” a pop culture catchphrase that characterizes the rockstar lifestyle. His debut album Issa in July 2017 earned him hits like “Bank Account” which peaked at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100 list. His tracks “X” and “No Heart” both cracked the top 50 on Billboard.
